creator: craig@brumfield.com
text:
I am using the new Checksum task to calculate a checksum for a list of files.  
The list of files to include are specified using a FileSet.  However, the 
checksum that is calculated is difference when run on the same files in 
different directories (or on another system) because the order in which the 
files are processed is not predictable.  I have tested a change to the Checksum 
task that sorts the list of files first and this does indeed, fix the problem.  
I think a better place for this change would be in the FileSet task.  Another 
property (sort=ascending|descending|directory) would control if results are 
sorted or not, and in which order.  This may be useful when using FileSet with 
other tasks in addition to Checksum.

Thanks,
CB

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
CVS HEAD contains support for the concept of ResourceCollections, including
fileset et al.  The <sort> resource collection should satisfy this request. 
Initially only a few tasks--concat, pathconvert, length and
resourcecount--support these directly; however tasks that accept paths 
should
automagically work with filesystem-based resource collections wrapped 
in paths.
 Feel welcome to submit patches to add ResourceCollection support to 
your
favorite task!
